extendedInfo.description: Custom Maps makes it easy to create GPS maps from map images, and those maps can be used anywhere, even when you have no data signal for your Android device (it works on both phones and tablets).Custom Maps can use photos of paper maps or brochures, and pictures of maps posted at trailheads or at the entrances to amusement parks. It can also use .jpeg or .png images downloaded from the internet and screenshots of PDF maps.All you have to do is choose two (or more) matching points that are common to both the map image and Google Maps, and Custom Maps can then show your GPS location on the map. Data connection is required at the time the map is calibrated (created).As the map images are stored on the phone, Custom Maps works offline without data signal. This is useful if you go hiking in national or state parks, and it can help you avoid international roaming charges abroad.Custom Maps can use almost any map image, including photos, as GPS maps so it can be a helpful map application when visiting zoos and amusement parks which typically post large maps of the park layout at the entrance of the park. Just take a photo of the posted map, line it up with Google Maps, and you can see your location on the map photo wherever you are in the park.Custom Maps can show the distance from your current location to a point on the map, so it can give you an idea how far different points are. This is especially useful for golfers who could create their own GPS maps for golf courses they play.Custom Maps uses simple image files for maps so you can add your own markup on the maps in a graphics tool (not included in Custom Maps) or draw entirely your own maps. Created maps can be shared using email from the app itself, or by hosting the map on a web server and posting QR codes for others to scan to trigger downloading of those maps.Custom Maps supports displaying placemarks on the map (starting in version 1.3.0). Placemark editing is not supported in Custom Maps itself (will be supported in a future version), but placemarks can be added in Google Earth. To add placemarks to a map, copy the kmz map file from phone to desktop computer, and open it with Google Earth. Create a folder in Google Earth containing the map overlay and add placemarks to the same folder. Then export the folder from Google Earth as kmz file, and copy back to phone.NOTE: Custom Maps app does not come with any maps included. The help menu for the map listing contains a link to www.custommapsapp.com website where you can download some sample maps to try. However, the best way to try Custom Maps is to take a photo of a paper map (or of an online map displayed on your computer screen) or download a map image from the web to your device, and then use Custom Maps to create a GPS enabled map from it.NOTE: On some devices, newly created maps don't show up in map list until the user returns back to map list from normal map display or after exiting and restarting the app. This seems to be an issue only with very few Android versions on specific devices, in most versions newly created maps show up immediately after they are created.You can find more information about Custom Maps at the application web site http://www.custommapsapp.com/.Custom Maps is an open source project. Its source code can be found at http://code.google.com/p/custom-maps/.

reviews.title: Very accurate!
reviews.comment: I drew a picture on the computer of my backyard and used a Google Maps image as a template. When I used that image in Custom Maps, it was pinpointing my EXACT location in the house. I recommend this to everyone who uses navigating apps but a hiking trail is missing.
reviews.author: Rahmi Husein

reviews.title: Nice App
reviews.comment: Very Cool.  I screen-capped a view of my neighborhood from Google Earth, sent it to my phone, and within  a very few minutes I had overlayed three points on Google Maps and went for a run.  It tracked my path perfectly, even down to which side of the street I was running on.  Nice.
reviews.author: Guy Gibson

reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin. Easy to use.
reviews.comment: Great app that is easy to use! Have imported sea-maps with great ease. I have been able to import the maps I\'ve created into Locus Map, and use Google My Tracks to track my progress.
reviews.author: Huni Sighvatsson

reviews.title: Excellent concept, works great
reviews.comment: Excellent concept to use more detailed maps on site, even without Internet access. Great support from the author, as well.
reviews.author: Nenad Milenkovic

reviews.title: Work as described
reviews.comment: I tried it in my home town. Work just fine. I will be using it on my trip oversea. Will be more useful if we could add way point on the map. Sharing map and location would be good to. The option to manually enter the GPS location or adding current spot using GPS without data service would be handy. For example, if I was standing in front of a landmark, I could just locate it on the map and add the location using GPS.
reviews.author: Nick Phati

reviews.title: Very useful
reviews.comment: This app is *fantastic* for off-roading and mountain biking. Download an image of the trail map, pick out a few common geo points, and off you go.
reviews.author: Jason Fish

reviews.title: The best 4 custom maps
reviews.comment: It does perfectly what is says for. I used screenshot from google.map and it was very perfect on showing my positions. I recommend this app to any researcher who wants to use it for reconnaissance and finding/confirming his position with respect to some bench mark/pre planned point (from map).  But dear developer can u add bit of functionality, it would be nice to use to max. 1. instead of showing position in X, Y format, it must show lat, long. 2. A facility to mark way point and a text note would be very much appreciated. Thanks and keep up good work
reviews.author: SK patil

reviews.title: Very useful
reviews.comment: This app is always on my phone. The last time I used it was to track location of an airline flight in progress.
reviews.author: Jim Herbold

reviews.title: Cannot make a single map
reviews.comment: Hi, what is the maximum filesize for this app? I keep compressing my tiffs to jpgs and pngs at 2, 3 % quality (>95 compression rate) and they come in at less than a MB, but still the filesize is too large. I was very, very hopeful when I found this, but if I can\'t make a map work then I\'ll have to wait for QGIS!  EDIT: Thank you for clarifying. I have reduced the pixel size and have been using this for chopper work up North. Thank you so much, incredible app! Upgraded to 5 stars!
reviews.author: Jordan Eamer

reviews.title: Cannot create map
reviews.comment: Google maps just keeps flickering and reloading. Tried rebooting. Still no go.
reviews.author: Jerry George

reviews.title: Very handy
reviews.comment: It\'s more easy to synchronize you own map to Google maps than using Google Earth. However, very often I have been allowed to create a map and then it\'s impossible to open the map again because suddenly it\'s too large.
reviews.author: David Petterson

reviews.title: Nearly perfect
reviews.comment: Needs to be able to open existing kmz files from somewhere like drop box. Aside from this the app is really fantastic.
reviews.author: Stephen Roberts

reviews.title: Brilliant and very useful
reviews.comment: I used it to create mountain bike map. Very easy to create, even from PDF (use online PDF to jpg converters).  I also used it for hiking in the forest.    Accurate even in the middle of the forest.   Now if only it can record my track too.
reviews.author: John Vu

reviews.title: It does more than I expected!
reviews.comment: An amazing map. I have triwd a couple of others before this one and there have been alqays some issues. This one is just great
reviews.author: Ziu Tek

reviews.title: Excelente Aplicativo
reviews.comment: O desenvolvedor est\303\241 de parab\303\251ns. Aplicativo excelente para usar ADC de aer\303\263dromos e qualquer mapa que quiser criar.
reviews.author: Jhonald Hern\303\241ndez

reviews.title: Very useful.
reviews.comment: Great app.  It allows you to geo-reference any image and then track your position on that map.  If you are geeked up about using your own maps as background this is your app.
reviews.author: John NunYaBiz

reviews.title: great app
reviews.comment: Finally managed to use my scanned maps as gps !  Thanks! It would be nice to support bigger files
reviews.author: To Sho

reviews.comment: A clever app very well executed.
reviews.author: john kelly

reviews.title: Really awesome
reviews.comment: Easy to use, presisce and accurate
reviews.author: Yathin Gunasekera
